events.question: A black grimoire with a pentacle on its cover is placed on the altar. Read a chapter?

events.text: What we call magic is the manipulation of energy that exists within all beings attuned with life, like animals, plants and us. This energy is referred to as "Mana".
Every living being can manipulate Mana, although the more intelligent that being is, the higher control it has over the Mana within itself. People who are proficient in Mana magic are called Mages.

Mana, in its purest form, takes the shape of white strings of light and is incredibly hard to produce and control. Instead, most Mages manifest Mana in their rougher yet still effective form, which are elements such as fire, ice, and earth.

The most powerful Mages of our kind who can cast advanced magic and manipulate pure Mana are bestowed with the title of Archmages. Rumors say that these Archmages may have learned the power to create life itself...
(Why do these pages smell like burnt incense...?)
It is said that the Mother Goddess, also known as the Genesis Lady or simply the [color=ffd703]Winged Cyclops[/color], taught humanity how to control the flow of Mana many, many years ago.

The Winged Cyclops is worshipped by the Church of the Cyclops, and the priests believe that once a month, during the full moon, she would bless the land with bountiful harvest, good fortune, and health.

However, some scholars of the magic academy believe that the full moon itself is the one that provides these blessings, enhancing the Mana present in all living beings, which can lead to accelerated growth in plants as well as boosted vitality in humans.

A controversial and hotly debated theory is that the origin of these blessings may be malicious, and that the Winged Cyclops isn't an all-benevolent deity that only serve humanity. Several sages think that the lunar phases are reflections of the deity's wills and powers.
Spells are mentally taxing to prepare and cast. In order to tap into Mana and cast a spell, a Mage must visualize it in their mind while running complex incantations and rituals through their mind.Â

A spell's sophisticated ritual must also be memorized by the Mage in order for them to be able to cast it at will. Even so, they need time to recharge their mental state before they can cast it again.
Some Mages carry a spellbook or grimoire to aid them in casting spells without the need to memorize them, but plenty of Mages also opt to have a [color=ffd703]familiar[/color].
A familiar can take many forms, but they most commonly manifest as a fey-like creature. They aid their masters by acting as a conduit for magic.
Gaining the trust of a familiar is a varied process. Some met them in the wild and befriended them. Some summoned them via a ritual and struck a deal in exchange for their aid.
